q1.question: Java is a high-level language.
q1.Explanation: Java is a high-level language because it is more easily understood by humans, Low=-level languages are always static.

q2.question: What kind of language is java?

q3.question: What is the result of 24 % 5?
q3.Explanation: % finds the remainder of an expression, the remainder of 24/5 being 4

q4.question: What is the default value of an integer?
q4.Explanation: When an integer is called and not defined, the default value is 0

q5.question: What is the default value of an object?
q5.Explanation: When an object is not defined, the default value is Not Assigned

q6.question: Is it possible to have multiple classes in the same java file?
q6.Explanation: It is possible to have multiple classes in the same java file.

q7.question: What does multiple inheritance mean?
options: Multiple classes inheriting from more super classes
Multiple classes inheriting from one super class
One class inheriting from multiple super classes
q7.answer: One class inheriting from multiple super classes
q7.Explanation: Multiple inheritance in java allows for one class to inherit from multiple super classes.

q8.question: What is the process that involves recognizing and focusing on the important characteristics of a situation or object is known as
q8.Explanation: Abstraction is the process that involves recognizing and focusing on the important characteristics of a situation or object.

q9.question: Is it possible to change the length of an array after it is made?

q10.question: Is it possible to change the length of an arraylist after it is made?
q10.Explanation: Arraylists are not static in length.

q11.question: What is a package a collection of?
q11.Explanation: Packages are collections of classes and interfaces.

q12.question: Which of the following are keywords?
q12.Explanation: All of the options are keywords, the list of all of them can be found here: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/_keywords.html

q13.question: Which of the following are Java IDEs?
q13.Explanation: All of the above are Java IDEs.

q14.question: What of the following are methods to create a GUI in java?
q14.Explanation: Java Swing and JavaFX can be used to create a GUI in java

q17.question:
What is the quantity of the following arraylist?
ArrayList list = new ArrayList();
q17.Explanation: The default quantity of an ArrayList is 10.

q19.question:
What is the output of the following code?
System.out.println(50/0)
q19.Explanation: Dividing an integer by 0 results in java.lang.ArithmeticException
